<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c63c6550.1503">   <title>CSC APEX </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c63c6550.1503</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>Can I ask how other APEX users are managing all the Stage 0 and AKI NA - Report without alert reports that are being generated? Has anyone found a way to suppress these reports, and if not what comments are being used for each stage?<br><br>Thanks<br>Heather,<br><br>Wye valley NHS Trust<br>Hereford<br>01432 355444 x 5706 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T11:52:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Clark, Heather</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c63c6550.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;baf1ee24.1503">   <title>Re: READ Code </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;baf1ee24.1503</link>   <description> I believe this is it<br><br>[cid:image001.png@01D054FB.9375F4D0]<br><br>Lorraine<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: ACB AKI-Detection-Algorithm [mailto:ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Bosomworth Mike (LEEDS TEACHING HOSPITALS NHS TRUST)<br>Sent: 02 March 2015 14:51<br>To: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: READ Code<br><br>---<br><br>This message was sent from an email address external to NHSmail but gives the appearance of being from an NHSmail (@nhs.net) address. The recipient should verify the sender and content before acting upon information contained within. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T15:14:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>COBBE LORRAINE (RM1) Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;baf1ee24.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;e6efd68e.1503">   <title>Re: READ Code </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;e6efd68e.1503</link>   <description> Dear Graham,<br><br>The code that I have seen is the same as for serum creatinine (44J3), which I hope is not the case just as I hope having creatinine clearance and eGFR with the same code (451E) is also a mistake.<br><br>Kind regards<br>Mike<br><br>Dr Mike Bosomworth<br>Clinical Service Lead for Blood Sciences and Specialist Laboratory Medicine<br>Tel: 0113 3922340<br>Mobile: 07789174344 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T14:50:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bosomworth Mike (LEEDS TEACHING HOSPITALS NHS TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;e6efd68e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;b584c48a.1503">   <title>READ Code </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;b584c48a.1503</link>   <description> Does anyone know the READ code to map the AKI stage onto third party GP systems?<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Graham   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T13:15:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graham White</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;b584c48a.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c0d3da50.1502">   <title>Re: Fwd: CSC Algorithm testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c0d3da50.1502</link>   <description> Apologies, my post seems to have lost the previous thread from January where I originally raised this issue (see https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c1653b77.1501 ).<br>This scenario occurs if the results concerned are entered close to each other in time (within a few minutes). The algorithm appears to be unable to avoid using creatinines dated after the result currently being calculated.<br>This may have been a poor example for &quot;real world&quot; consideration - no result would be reported a week after sampling! - but this could easily occur for samples taken within a day or so of each other.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T15:55:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alan Dodd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;c0d3da50.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bf87ee0b.1502">   <title>Fwd: CSC Algorithm testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bf87ee0b.1502</link>   <description> Dear Alan,<br><br>Thank you for raising this issue.<br><br>This is an issue of governance issue as quality of care audit work and<br>outcome work is compromised if the incident date of the AKI is incorrect.<br><br>A key outcome is the *30 day mortality*.<br><br>Without the *correct incident date* Trusts will struggle to know how they<br>did. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:51:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah De Freitas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bf87ee0b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;99eca8a.1502">   <title>Re: CSC Algorithm testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;99eca8a.1502</link>   <description> At the risk of being proven wrong, I don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt think that the algorithm is working as expected Alan as I would have thought the stage 2 result should have first appeared on 01/06/2014 result. Also according to the guidance the 0 should not appear, but that is proving a challenge to us also as we are having to report NA instead of 0.<br>Kind regards<br>Mike [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:50:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bosomworth Mike (LEEDS TEACHING HOSPITALS NHS TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;99eca8a.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;2b1b9288.1502">   <title>Re: CSC Algorithm testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;2b1b9288.1502</link>   <description> Hi,<br><br>Quick question, I don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt have the CSC software but I noticed that you had AKI 2 on two of your previous results (4th &amp; 5th sample). I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdve calculated the ratio between these results and only the final result has a ratio of &gt;1.5 that is required for you to even branch to the AKI 2 alert. Is it a typo? I only got the AKI 2 on the final sample. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:46:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>COBBE LORRAINE (RM1) Norfolk and Norwich University Hospital</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;2b1b9288.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;8426850d.1502">   <title>A correct incident date for AKI is key to auditing 30 day mortality and morbidity </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;8426850d.1502</link>   <description> Dear Alan,<br><br>Thank you for raising this issue.<br><br>This is an issue of governance issue as quality of care audit work and<br>outcome work is compromised if the incident date of the AKI is incorrect.<br><br>A key outcome is the *30 day mortality*.<br><br>Without the *correct incident date* Trusts will struggle to know how they<br>did. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:45:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah De Freitas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;8426850d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9a7d00fe.1502">   <title>Re: CSC Algorithm testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9a7d00fe.1502</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9a7d00fe.1502">Re: CSC Algorithm testing </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T14:06:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alan Dodd</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9a7d00fe.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9fa4d407.1502">   <title>Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9fa4d407.1502</link>   <description> I have heard that clinisys have released the algorithm.<br><br>best wishes<br>Anne<br>Dr Anne Dawnay PhD FRCPath<br>Consultant Biochemist<br>Clinical Lead for Clinical Biochemistry &amp; Chair UCLH POCT Committee<br>020 344 72954 direct dial<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Dawnay,Anne<br>Sent: 18 February 2015 08:38<br>To: 'ACB AKI-Detection-Algorithm'<br>Subject: RE: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest<br>- 16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T13:29:48-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anne Dawnay</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;9fa4d407.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;97c76a5e.1502">   <title>Paediatric creatinine ULRI </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;97c76a5e.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleagues<br><br>Is there a common ULRI for creatinine for patients &lt;18 years of age? We currently don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt have a separate RI for paediatrics, so this may compromise detection of AKI3 using the algorithm.<br><br>Any advice appreciated.<br><br>Phil   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T10:03:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Phillip Monaghan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;97c76a5e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;87e32944.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest - 16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;87e32944.1502</link>   <description> The algorithm is working in background on our system (Telepath) fine, except that we are having a real problem in complying with not reporting AKI 0. We can use 'NA' but our system is not clever enough to distinguish between 'NA' because it is AKI 0 and 'NA' because, for example, there is no previous result or it is not being reported for that location (primary care) etc. We can add comments of course, but coming up with a composite comment to cover all eventualities is difficult. None of the above is absolutely insurmountable. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T09:42:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bosomworth Mike (LEEDS TEACHING HOSPITALS NHS TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;87e32944.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6491d0b8.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest - 16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6491d0b8.1502</link>   <description> Dear Anne,<br><br>Very interesting to hear you have noticed an increase in the numbers of AKI flags between your old method and using the new algorithm.<br><br>We have used a similar in house check for some time, and I would be concerned if a lot more were flagged.<br><br>Can I ask, did your previous method include all patients irrespective of the creatinine level, i.e. latest creatinine within sex related reference range? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T10:06:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mascall, Gary (WRH Biochemistry Medical Staff)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6491d0b8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bb037612.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest - 16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bb037612.1502</link>   <description> PS I should add that clinisys will supply the test script to you when<br>they have the hot fix available for use. Anne<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Dawnay,Anne<br>Sent: 18 February 2015 08:36<br>To: 'ACB AKI-Detection-Algorithm'<br>Subject: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest -<br>16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11)<br><br>We have been testing the clinisys AKI hotfix algorithm at UCLH. A number<br>of issues were detected in test winpath that appear to have been fixed. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T08:38:19-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anne Dawnay</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;bb037612.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;ec88ea44.1502">   <title>Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm RE: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM Digest - 16 Feb 2015 to 17 Feb 2015 (#2015-11) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;ec88ea44.1502</link>   <description> We have been testing the clinisys AKI hotfix algorithm at UCLH. A number<br>of issues were detected in test winpath that appear to have been fixed.<br><br>It was installed in live winpath earlier last week for test patients<br>only - that revealed some unintended consequences that are being fixed.<br><br>We started running for patients in live winpath from last Friday<br>alongside our existing alert - we currently flag 50% increase from<br>previous result.<br>The new AKI warning comment is suppressed and not visible to clinicians<br>or intelligible to lab staff apart from a few of us - we continue to<br> [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T08:35:39-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Anne Dawnay</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;ec88ea44.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;eb72ec53.1502">   <title>AKI algorithm testing scripts </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;eb72ec53.1502</link>   <description> Is there any mechanism to get hold of the AKI algorithm testing scripts?<br><br>Our LIMS provider is HP (we still use the Swift IHCS LIMS (HP). The NHS Algorithm is written and ready to test in our training systems and we don't want to write our own testing scripts if they already exist. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T16:49:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Liz Burgess</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;eb72ec53.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;192fde4f.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;192fde4f.1502</link>   <description> Hi Sally<br><br>Would you be able to share a testing script?<br><br>Hope all is well<br>Hazel<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: ACB AKI-Detection-Algorithm [mailto:ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Benton Sally (ROYAL SURREY COUNTY HOSPITAL NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)<br>Sent: 17 February 2015 10:12<br>To: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm<br><br>---<br>This message was sent from an email address external to NHSmail but gives the appearance of being from an NHSmail (@nhs.net) address. The recipient should verify the sender and content before acting upon information contained within. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T10:41:01+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Borthwick Hazel (RXP) Pathology Biochemistry</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;192fde4f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa1c9f99.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa1c9f99.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>We have been beta testing the Clinisys AKI algorithm patch at Surrey Pathology Services. Just concluding it now. I will post some details on here later this week of our findings. We haven't yet done the live testing to demonstrate impact on the IT system as a whole but will also feed that back as soon as we can. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T10:11:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Benton Sally (ROYAL SURREY COUNTY HOSPITAL NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa1c9f99.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;4477a213.1502">   <title>Re: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;4477a213.1502</link>   <description> I've been told the patch is back with Clinisys development team.<br><br>Do people have a script to test it against? If so, could they share it as I've been asking for a basic template but not getting anywhere.<br><br>Thanks<br>Hazel<br><br>County Durham and Darlington NHS Trust<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: ACB AKI-Detection-Algorithm [mailto:ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gary Mascall<br>Sent: 16 February 2015 10:21<br>To: ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T08:57:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Borthwick Hazel (RXP) Pathology Biochemistry</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;4477a213.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6954a565.1502">   <title>Clinisys WinPath AKI algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6954a565.1502</link>   <description> Have any Clinisys WinPath users seen their version of the AKI algorithm yet?<br>It was supposed to be released by the end of January, but they are being somewhat vague/evasive as to when it will be installed. We are on SP 28 which is supposed to be the version it was to be included in, but it is not there.<br>So, if anyone has it already we would be very interested to know, and how it is going with testing against the script.<br>Many Thanks,<br>Gary Mascall<br>Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T10:21:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gary Mascall</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;6954a565.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa48e8a9.1502">   <title>Re: Specification document for AKI data sent to the UK renal registry </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa48e8a9.1502</link>   <description> Following a merger of pathology services, our laboratory now provides biochemistry/AKI scores to 2 separate trusts. We have had some discussions regarding where responsibilities lie in submitting data to the renal registry (does the lab submit a joint file with data for both trusts) - could I what other labs are doing in this situation? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-11T12:34:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Darby Denise (SALFORD ROYAL NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;fa48e8a9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;cfb5d86e.1502">   <title>Telepath algorithm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;cfb5d86e.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I am using the algorithm in telepath. I recently posted about the algorithm giving an AKI=0 for unreportable creatinine results (creat =NA). This has now been fixed (thanks to those who replied about the updated software version). But, now the algorithm does not report AKI= 0 at all, in those where an AKI alert may be calculated but found NOT to be AKI, the result is AKI=NA. This obviously makes it difficult to distinguish those patients who do not qualify for the algorithm (i.e. no previous, excluded wards) and those where the creatinine value indicates no AKI. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T12:58:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hill Charlotte (RQ6) RLBUHT</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-AKI-ALGORITHM;cfb5d86e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
